name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Unleashes Conqueror's Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Conqueror's Haki for the first time in the anime, knocking out most people in the auction house instantly.
keyMoments.significance: This is the first major demonstration of Haki in the anime series, introducing a fundamental power system.
keyMoments.quote: What just happened? Everyone just collapsed!

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Removes Camie's Explosive Collar
keyMoments.description: Using advanced Armament Haki, Rayleigh safely removes Camie's explosive collar just before it detonates.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates advanced Haki technique that Luffy will later learn and use in Wano.
keyMoments.quote: Don't worry, I'll have that off in a moment.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Instructs Pirates to Escape
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh tells the young pirates he'll leave their escape to them and instructs them to regroup at Grove 13.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Rayleigh's faith in the new generation and establishes him as a mentor figure.
keyMoments.quote: I'll leave the escape to you young ones. Head to Grove 13.

reveals.information: Can use Conqueror's Haki to knock out multiple people simultaneously
Possesses advanced Armament Haki capable of safely removing explosive collars

abilities.description: The ability to dominate the wills of others, knocking out those with weak willpower.
Advanced technique allowing precise control over Haki to disarm explosive devices.

keyMoments.title: Exits Auction House with Kid and Law
keyMoments.description: Luffy walks out alongside Eustass Kid and Trafalgar Law to face the Marines, bickering with them over who could handle the siege alone.
keyMoments.significance: Iconic moment showing the three captains of the Worst Generation standing together for the first time.
keyMoments.quote: I could clear this whole thing by myself!

keyMoments.title: Uses Gomu Gomu no Fusen Against Marines
keyMoments.description: Luffy inflates his body to deflect incoming cannonballs from the Marine siege.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates defensive use of his rubber abilities.

name.japanese: トラファルガー・ロー

keyMoments.title: First Display of 'Room' Ability
keyMoments.description: Law creates a spherical energy field called 'Room' and uses his surgical powers to swap a Marine's head with a cannonball, keeping the Marine alive.
keyMoments.significance: First demonstration of Law's Ope Ope no Mi Devil Fruit powers and his signature 'Room' technique.

keyMoments.title: Stands with Luffy and Kid Against Marines
keyMoments.description: Law exits the auction house alongside Luffy and Kid, forming an iconic trio of Supernova captains.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Law as one of the key members of the Worst Generation and foreshadows future alliances.

abilities.description: Creates a spherical domain in which Law can freely manipulate the positions and orientations of objects and people, and perform surgical procedures.

reveals.information: Possesses the Ope Ope no Mi Devil Fruit, allowing him to create a 'Room' and perform surgical manipulations

keyMoments.title: Displays Magnetic Devil Fruit Powers
keyMoments.description: Kid uses his magnetic abilities to stop an incoming cannonball and redirect it back at the Marines' artillery with devastating force.
keyMoments.significance: First clear demonstration of Kid's Jiki Jiki no Mi (Magnet-Magnet Fruit) powers in the anime.

keyMoments.title: Forms Iconic Trio with Luffy and Law
keyMoments.description: Kid exits the auction house alongside Luffy and Law, bickering about who could handle the Marines alone.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Kid's competitive rivalry with Luffy and sets up future interactions between the three captains.
keyMoments.quote: Hah! That's my line, Straw Hat!

abilities.description: The ability to generate and manipulate magnetic forces to attract and repel metallic objects.

reveals.information: Possesses the Jiki Jiki no Mi Devil Fruit, granting magnetic powers to control and manipulate metal

name.japanese: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

keyMoments.title: First Mention of SMILEs
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo tells Disco that slavery is passé and declares that SMILEs are the future, abandoning the auction house business.
keyMoments.significance: Major foreshadowing moment that won't pay off for over 200 episodes, introducing the concept of artificial Devil Fruits.
keyMoments.quote: Slavery is passé. SMILEs are the future.

keyMoments.title: Abandons the Human Auctioning House
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo cuts ties with the auction house business completely, leaving Disco to deal with the consequences alone.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Doflamingo's ruthless business pragmatism and shift toward the artificial Devil Fruit trade.
keyMoments.quote: I'm done with the auction house. You're on your own.

reveals.information: Is moving away from the slave trade to focus on a new venture involving 'SMILEs'

keyMoments.title: Explains What 'Haki' Is
keyMoments.description: Hatchan identifies and names the mysterious power Rayleigh used as 'Haki,' introducing the term to the audience for the first time.
keyMoments.significance: This is the first time the word 'Haki' is spoken in the One Piece anime, establishing it as a legitimate power system.

reveals.information: Has knowledge of Haki and recognizes it when used

keyMoments.title: Rescued from Explosive Collar
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh uses advanced Haki technique to safely remove Camie's explosive slave collar.
keyMoments.significance: Camie is freed from slavery, and the scene demonstrates advanced Haki application.

keyMoments.title: Dispatches Admiral Kizaru to Sabaody
keyMoments.description: Sengoku orders Admiral Kizaru to immediately go to Sabaody Archipelago to respond to the attack on the Celestial Dragon.
keyMoments.significance: This decision sets in motion the events that will scatter the Straw Hat crew and lead to the time skip.
keyMoments.quote: Kizaru, go to Sabaody immediately. We cannot let this attack on the Celestial Dragons go unanswered.

keyMoments.title: Dispatched to Sabaody Archipelago
keyMoments.description: Admiral Kizaru is ordered by Sengoku to go to Sabaody Archipelago to deal with the pirates who attacked a Celestial Dragon.
keyMoments.significance: Kizaru's deployment marks the beginning of the catastrophic events that will separate the Straw Hat crew.

reveals.information: Is one of the three Marine Admirals and is dispatched to handle threats to Celestial Dragons

keyMoments.title: Abandoned by Doflamingo
keyMoments.description: Disco contacts Doflamingo for help but is told that Doflamingo is abandoning the auction house business entirely.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the consequences of Disco's business partnership with Doflamingo and leaves him to face the Straw Hats alone.
